description.narrative: EAPR has strengthened evidence, partnerships and resource mobilization capacity to improve WASH outcomes.

UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: EAPR has strengthened evidence, partnerships and resource mobilization capacity to improve WASH outcomes.

description.narrative: Increased cross-country learning and exchanges, enhanced cross- sectoral collaboration and innovative partnerships particularly with Singapore Water Academy, University of Technology, Australia, ASEAN with enhanced focus on evidence generation continued to guide regional advocacy leading to increased resource leverage for quality WASH programming in development and humanitarian contexts for improved WASH outcomes for children in the region. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020

title.narrative: Emerging Issues: Number of WASH EAPRO and HQ led initiatives undertaken to explore emerging WASH related child and maternal health issues (climate change, urban WASH for poor, water quality threat etc.) (modified)
Innovations: Number of new innovative initiatives (technology, approaches or partnerships) initiated, tested with EAPRO WASH support

baseline.value: 3 (1. ASEAN Secretariat and SDGs Event 2. Singapore Government 3. Nutrition and WASH Toolkit (Cambodia, PNG, DPRK)

title.narrative: Partnerships: Number of partners including Private sector engagements that actively engage with UNICEF and support UNICEF and support UNICEF's WASH initiatives and results

baseline.value: 3 (Water Aid Australia, CLTS Foundation in India and CLTS Knowledge Hub Prof. R. Chambers)

title.narrative: Advocacy: Number of joint advocacy and/or networking events with key regional partners

baseline.value: 4 (1. WASH in School International Learning event in Myanmar 2. Training Programme in Singapore Leaving No One Behind 3. Joint EAPRO WASH/Nutrition Network Meeting 4. ASEAN UNICEF Symposium (WASH on

title.narrative: Knowledge Management: Number of regional sanitation knowledge/evidence products are developed, published and disseminated by EAPRO or with other offices

baseline.value: 5 (WASH Regional Analysis: 1. Water, 2. Sanitation &amp, Hygiene, 3. Pacific WASH, JMP Office: 4. Scoping Study on WASH in School for SDGs and 5. Scoping Study on WASH in Healthcare Facility)

title.narrative: Inter-sectoral Initiatives: Active engagement in the office wide cross-sectoral groups as Gender, Resilience, ECD and number of intersectoral initiatives includes WASH.
